content.webTitle: CD: Pop review: Various, Take Me To the River: A Southern Soul Story 1961-1977

fields.headline: Pop review: Various, Take Me To the River
fields.bodyText: Ever felt like an introduction to the flip-side of the brand of soul championed by Motown in the Sixties? Back down south, (often white) songwriters like Dan Penn and artists of the stature of William Bell, Aretha Franklin and Al Green dealt with the trickier, grown-up stuff. Over three CDs here are 75 ageless tracks.
